qas.question: What was the name of the first solid-state laser consumer LaserDisc player?
Besides a solid-state laser, what else was unique about the LD-700?

answers.text: first LD player to load from the front and not the top

qas.question: When did Pioneer release the LD-700?
Which company continued to use gas-lasers in industrial models of LD players although they were no longer used in consumer models?

context: In <a2_0>March 1984<a2_0/>, Pioneer introduced the first consumer player with a solid-state laser, the <a0_0>LD-700<a0_0/>. It was also the <a1_0>first LD player to load from the front and not the top<a1_0/>. One year earlier Hitachi introduced an expensive industrial player with a laser diode, but the player, which had poor picture quality due to an inadequate dropout compensator, was made only in limited quantities. After Pioneer released the LD-700, gas lasers were no longer used in consumer players, despite their advantages, although <a3_0>Philips<a3_0/> continued to use gas lasers in their industrial units until 1985.
